definition: to fight with all one has
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Here are a few chick flick tips.
sentences.chinese: 这里有几个小鸡搏命小费。

sentences.english: But war is merciless, how could it be possible to prevent casualties?
sentences.chinese: 战争是残酷搏命的玩意儿，怎会不死人呢？

sentences.english: They, however, have little spare private time, face death every second as well.
sentences.chinese: 他们过着没有自己时间的生活，也是九死一生的搏命。

definition: to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to stake all on one throw
a cornered beast will still fight (idiom)/to fight like an animal at bay
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
to put one's all into the fight
to grapple (with the enemy)/to fight at the risk of one's life
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
